Package MMS

Class List

java.lang.Object
MMS.List
public class List
extends java.lang.Object
Represents a list of Nodes. Each node holds a reference to a memory block.
(Part of Homework 10 in the Intro to CS course, Efi Arazi School of CS)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    List()
    Constructs a new list of Node objects, each holding a memory block (MemBlock object)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(int index, MemBlock block)
    Adds a new node to this list, as follows: Creates a new node containing the given memory block, and inserts the node at the given index in this list.

    Adds the given memory block at the beginning of this list.
    void addLast​(MemBlock block)
    Adds the given memory block to the end of this list.
    MemBlock getBlock​(int index)
    Gets the memory block located at the given index in this list.
    Node getNode​(int index)
    Gets the node located at the given index in this list.
    int indexOf​(MemBlock block)
    Gets the index of the node containing the given memory block.
    ListIterator iterator()
    Returns an iterator over this list, starting with the first element.
    void remove​(MemBlock block)
    Removes the given memory block from this list.

    Removes the first memory block from this list.

    A textual representation of this list.

    • List

      public List()
      Constructs a new list of Node objects, each holding a memory block (MemBlock object)

  • Method Details

    • addLast

      public void addLast​(MemBlock block)
      Adds the given memory block to the end of this list. Executes efficiently, in O(1).
      Parameters:
      block - The memory block that is added at the list's end

    • addFirst

      public void addFirst​(MemBlock block)
      Adds the given memory block at the beginning of this list. Executes efficiently, in O(1).
      Parameters:
      block - The memory block that is added at the list's beginning

    • getNode

      public Node getNode​(int index)
      Gets the node located at the given index in this list.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the node to get, between 0 and size - 1
      Returns:
      The node at the given index
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If index is negative or greater than size - 1

    • getBlock

      public MemBlock getBlock​(int index)
      Gets the memory block located at the given index in this list.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the memory block to get, between 0 and size - 1
      Returns:
      The memory block at the given index
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If index is negative or greater than size - 1

    • indexOf

      public int indexOf​(MemBlock block)
      Gets the index of the node containing the given memory block.
      Parameters:
      block - The given memory block
      Returns:
      The index of the memory block, or -1 if the memory block is not in this list

    • add

      public void add​(int index, MemBlock block)
      Adds a new node to this list, as follows: Creates a new node containing the given memory block, and inserts the node at the given index in this list. For example, if this list is (m7, m3, m1, m6), then add(2,m5) will make this list (m7, m3, m5, m1, m6). If the given index is 0, the new node becomes the first node in this list. If the given index equals the list's size - 1, the new node becomes the last node in this list. If the new element is added at the beginning or at the end of this list, the addition's runtime is O(1). Othewrise is it O(size).
      Parameters:
      block - The memory block to add
      index - Where to insert the memory block
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If index is negative or greater than the list's size - 1

    • removeFirst

      public void removeFirst()
      Removes the first memory block from this list. Executes efficiently, in O(1).
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If trying to remove from an empty list

    • remove

      public void remove​(MemBlock block)
      Removes the given memory block from this list.
      Parameters:
      block - The memory block to remove

    • iterator

      public ListIterator iterator()
      Returns an iterator over this list, starting with the first element.
      Returns:
      A ListIterator object

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      A textual representation of this list.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      A string representing this list
